poem:
Resurrection in Red Hats

A phoenix in a suit  
rises from rusted rhetoric—  
askew ties flutter whispers  
over once-burnt bridges.  

In foreign winds,  
alarms unravel,  
their echoes cradling  
the world's breath.  

History leans forward,  
curious—  
as shadows cast  
by orange dawn  
dance.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Donald Trump elected US president in stunning political resurrection Donald Trump has been elected the 47th president of the United States in a stunning political resurrection that sent shockwaves through America and around the world. Trump becomes the first convicted criminal to win the White House. At 78 he is also the oldest person ever elected to the office. The result will sound alarm bells in foreign capitals given Trump’s chaotic leadership style and overtures". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
